alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 8:11AM MDT until April 18 at 8:55AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Jemez River Above Jemez Pueblo affecting Sandoval County. .Warm temperatures continue to cause rapid melting of snowpack, causing increased river flows. Much of the snow has melted but with the return of warm temperatures on monday we could see river levels rise again. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Jemez River above Jemez Pueblo. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Between 7 and 8 feet multiple locations along highway 4 between San Ysidro and Jemez Springs will see water crossing the road from tributaries and low water crossing points. The Wastewater Treatment plant 1 mile DS of Jemez Springs can be impacted between 7 and 7.7 feet. Water will be on Highway 4 at mile marker 1, 2 and 13. Homes near the river in San Ysidro could be impacted. At 8.0 feet, Significant overbank flows are occurring from above Jemez Springs down through the Jemez Pueblo. Further rises will result in bridges becoming unsafe to cross in and around Jemez Springs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 7.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 08/26/1963. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Jemez River Jemez Puebl 8.0 6.2 Sat 7 am MDT 6.0 7.0 7.1 &&
info.instruction: Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 900 PM MDT.
